results.title: Crafting a Rom-Com That’s True to 21st-Century Gay Life
results.abstract: Billy Eichner and the “Bros” team made news by casting queer actors, but they also focused on writing a story that didn’t recycle straight tropes.

results.title: The Business of Making ‘Pleasure’
results.abstract: The screenwriter-director Ninja Thyberg and the actor Sofia Kappel discuss creating a porn industry drama through a feminist lens.

results.title: At Cannes, a case for movies in a TikTok world.
results.abstract: Our reporter reflects on his first night at the Cannes Film Festival, an event that can sometimes seem like a throwback to an earlier age.

results.title: Nobody Makes Films Like Alex Garland. But He Might Stop Making Them.
results.abstract: The man behind “Men” says of directing, “I don’t particularly enjoy it. It’s something I have to force myself to do.”

results.title: How Hollywood and the Media Fueled the Political Rise of J.D. Vance
results.abstract: “Hillbilly Elegy,” a best-selling memoir that became a star-studded film, raised the profile of the onetime “Never Trump guy” who won an Ohio primary with the help of the former president.
des_facet: Hillbilly Elegy: A Memoir of a Family and Culture in Crisis (Book)

multimedia.caption: J.D. Vance, who once said he was a “Never Trump guy,” won the Republican nomination for an Ohio Senate seat with the support of former President Donald J. Trump.

results.title: In ‘The Innocents,’ Kids Behaving Deadly
results.abstract: Eskil Vogt, the Oscar-nominated co-writer of “The Worst Person in the World,” explores a childhood paradox in his new horror movie: how kids can be both innocent and cruel.

results.title: David Fincher Tries Animation in ‘Love, Death + Robots’
results.abstract: The director made his first animated short for the new season of this Netflix anthology. “It was an incredibly freeing, eye-opening, mind-expanding way to interface with a story,” he said.

multimedia.caption: “Bad Travelling,” part of the new season of “Love, Death + Robots,” on Netflix, was David Fincher’s first animated short.

results.abstract: A new film about the celebrated graphic designer follows his career as the scale of his projects goes from small to extra large to global.

results.abstract: His moody 2004 film, ‘Distant,’ about an unemployed factory worker in Istanbul, has been revived for a short run at Film Forum in Manhattan.

results.title: Even glittering Cannes can’t avoid the war in Ukraine.

results.title: ‘The hate of men will pass, and dictators die’: Zelensky quotes Chaplin in an address to Cannes.

results.title: Meet this year’s Cannes jury.
results.abstract: Each year, the jury chooses the festival’s top prizes, including the Palme d’Or. This year it’s led by the actor Vincent Lindon.

multimedia.caption: Vincent Lindon, the jury president of the 75th Cannes Film Festival, center, and the jury members, from left, Deepika Padukone, Noomi Rapace, Jasmine Trinca and Rebecca Hall in Cannes on Tuesday.

results.title: The festival gives Forest Whitaker an honorary Palme d’Or lifetime achievement award.
results.abstract: The festival’s opening ceremony played clips from some of his of movies, including “Bird,” “Ghost Dog,” “The Color of Money” and “Panic Room.”

results.title: Fred Ward, Star of ‘The Right Stuff’ and ‘Henry and June,’ Dies at 79
